title: Big European Banks Get Prodded on Climate Promises
summary: Investor activist ShareAction says many lenders are lagging in their commitment to cut financing to carbon polluters. Europe's largest banks have pledged to phase out financing carbon dioxide emissions by 2050. But an activist group supported by big shareholders says the lenders aren't doing enough to meet their goals.

title: Wallets Are Over. Your Phone Is Your Everything Now.
summary: Mobile payments replacing credit cards was just the start. Digital versions of your work ID, driver's license and other card holdouts are coming to your smartphone.. If you need someone to predict the future, Spike Feresten is your guy.

title: Military Faction Stages Coup in Mineral-Rich Guinea
summary: Putsch comes amid deepening instability across West Africa. A faction of Guinea's military claimed to have taken charge of the mineral-rich nation on Sunday, as officers from an elite special forces unit declared that they had suspended the constitution and detained President Alpha Condé following hours of clashes in the West African nation's capital.

title: TotalEnergies to Invest $27 Billion in Iraq
summary: French energy giant signs 25-year deal spanning fossil fuel and renewables. French energy giant TotalEnergies SE plans to invest $27 billion in Iraq in a 25-year deal, according to people familiar with the matter, boosting its position in the country at a time when other Western companies have been rethinking their exposure.

title: Economy Week Ahead: China Trade, Fed Talk, ECB's Next Move
summary: U.S. jobless claims are expected to fall to a fresh pandemic low in the week ended Sept. 4. Trade and inflation data from China, Federal Reserve speakers and the European Central Bank's next policy move will be in focus this week.

title: Biden's Aides Head Abroad After U.S. Afghan Pullout
summary: Antony Blinken and Lloyd Austin to meet counterparts who helped U.S. evacuate after collapse of Afghan military and government. Top U.S. officials are headed to the Middle East as the Biden administration grapples for ways to continue getting American citizens and Afghan partners out of the country now that all U.S. forces have left, while looking toward future relations with the Taliban-controlled government.

title: Navy Declares Five Sailors Dead After Helicopter Crash
summary: A three-day search followed crash of MH-60S helicopter off San Diego. The U.S. Navy said five crew members of a military helicopter that crashed last week were dead after a three-day search-and-rescue mission in the waters off San Diego proved unsuccessful.

title: How Much College Debt Should Students and Parents Take On? Here's How to Figure It Out.
summary: Resume Subscription. Borrowing for college is considered a given by many families.

title: Inside Biden's Afghanistan Withdrawal Plan: Warnings, Doubts but Little Change
summary: Resume Subscription. In June, as security worsened in Afghanistan, National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan began to raise questions about the rapid pace of U.S. military withdrawal.

title: China's Industrial Planning Evolves, Stirring U.S. Concerns
summary: Beijing is catching up through technology investments in research with industrial applications, echoing American strategy. For decades, China pursued a brand of centrally planned economic policies that the U.S. was happy to stand back and watch.

title: Progressives' Tax-the-Rich Dreams Fade as Democrats Struggle for Votes
summary: Congress is poised to pass a significant tax increase, but some ambitious Biden ideas may not make it over the finish line. WASHINGTON-Progressive Democrats, who had hoped unified party control of the government could spur transformative tax increases on multinational companies and wealthy individuals, look like they will have to settle for a more modest outcome.

title: Islamic State Kills at Least 12 Police in Iraq Amid Resurgence Fears
summary: Attack on a police outpost in Kirkuk province was followed by two other assaults. BAGHDAD-Islamic State militants killed at least 12 Iraqi policemen and wounded several more in an overnight attack at an outpost near the city of Kirkuk amid concerns that the group is expanding its attacks in Iraq and Syria.

title: When Financial Experts Refer to a 'Blowoff Top,' Here's What They Are Talking About
summary: They aren't exactly an everyday occurrence in financial markets, but they can have a big impact on investors. Lately, some financial-market experts have been using the phrase "blowoff top" to describe how prices for certain assets have behaved. While blowoff tops aren't an everyday occurrence, they can have an impact on investors-potentially producing big profits or devastating losses.

title: Dine In? Go Out? Learn to Be a Better Covid Risk Manager
summary: Deciding which activities to pursue is more complicated with the Delta variant. Here's how scientists evaluate office work, dinner parties and restaurants.. Determining what's safe-and what isn't-in the era of the Delta variant is forcing all of us to become our own personal risk managers.

title: U.S. Ports See Shipping Logjams Likely Extending Far Into 2022
summary: With record volumes of goods reaching the U.S., port executives expect a crush of container imports beyond the holidays. Leaders of some of the busiest U.S. ports expect congestion snarling maritime gateways to continue deep into next year, as the crush of goods from manufacturers and retailers looking to replenish depleted inventories pushes past shipping's usual seasonal lulls.

title: Search for Yield Leads Bond Buyers to Unrated Debt
summary: Junk-bond managers have rarely encountered less appealing terms. Many are responding by venturing into new areas.. Record low interest rates on riskier corporate bonds are prompting money managers to look far afield in a bid to boost returns.

title: Chinese Firms Adopt Rigorous Sexual-Harassment Policies
summary: Tech companies, including Trip.com and iQiyi, move to confront their codes of conduct on issue. TAIPEI-The sexual-assault scandal at Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. that spurred a backlash online about workplace culture is driving other Chinese companies to confront, or create, their own policies on sexual harassment.

title: Child Covid Cases Rise in States Where Schools Opened Earliest
summary: Number of infections climbed in states where school has been in session for weeks; thousands of students see closures and quarantines. The recent spread of the highly contagious Delta variant has thrown back-to-school plans into disarray, temporarily driving tens of thousands of students back to virtual learning or pausing instruction altogether.
